event.summary: 06/21/1993: ETA was suspected of setting off a car bomb during rush hour, under a bridge in the Salamanca district in central Madrid. Seven people were killed and 21 wounded. The dead were soldiers whose vehicle was parked next to the car when the bomb exploded.
event.target1: Rush hour commuters traveling in the Salamanca district of central Madrid
event.addnotes: This is one of two linked incidents (cf. 199306210002).
event.scite1: “Seven dead, 20 injured in car bomb attacks – police,” Agence France Presse, June 21, 1993.
event.scite2: Susan Linnee, “Two Car Bombs Show Weakened ETA Still Capable of Death Blows,” The Associated Press, June 21, 1993.
event.scite3: Ciaran Giles, “Car Bombs Rock Madrid Rush Hour; Seven Dead, 25 Injured,” The Associated Press, June 21, 1993.
